name: CreateRunnerGroupForOrg
description:
Create a self-hosted runner group for an organization.

This tool creates a new self-hosted runner group for an organization on GitHub. Requires authentication with an access token having the `admin:org` scope.

parameters.name: organization_name
parameters.description: The name of the organization. It is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The organization name. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: runner_group_name
parameters.description: Name of the self-hosted runner group to be created. This should be a descriptive and distinct name within your organization.

parameters.name: runner_ids_to_add
parameters.description: List of runner IDs to include in the newly created runner group for the organization.

value_schema.description: List of runner IDs to add to the runner group.

parameters.name: accessible_repository_ids
parameters.description: List of repository IDs that can access the runner group.

value_schema.description: List of repository IDs that can access the runner group.

parameters.name: allowed_workflows
parameters.description: List of workflows names the runner group is permitted to run. Considered only if 'restricted_to_workflows' is true.

value_schema.description: List of workflows the runner group should be allowed to run. This setting will be ignored unless `restricted_to_workflows` is set to `true`.

parameters.name: runner_group_visibility
parameters.description: Specify the visibility of the runner group: 'selected' for individual repositories, 'all' for all repositories, or 'private' for private repositories only.

value_schema.description: Visibility of a runner group. You can select all repositories, select individual repositories, or limit access to private repositories.

parameters.name: allow_public_repositories
parameters.description: Set to true to allow the runner group to be used by public repositories.

value_schema.description: Whether the runner group can be used by `public` repositories.

parameters.name: restrict_to_selected_workflows
parameters.description: Set to true to restrict the runner group to run only the workflows in the selected_workflows array.

value_schema.description: If `true`, the runner group will be restricted to running only the workflows specified in the `selected_workflows` array.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the GitHub API.

parameters.name: org
parameters.description: The organization name. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The organization name. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: allows_public_repositories
parameters.description: Whether the runner group can be used by `public` repositories.

value_schema.description: Whether the runner group can be used by `public` repositories.

parameters.name: restricted_to_workflows
parameters.description: If `true`, the runner group will be restricted to running only the workflows specified in the `selected_workflows` array.

value_schema.description: If `true`, the runner group will be restricted to running only the workflows specified in the `selected_workflows` array.

parameters.name: runners
parameters.description: List of runner IDs to add to the runner group.

value_schema.description: List of runner IDs to add to the runner group.

parameters.name: selected_repository_ids
parameters.description: List of repository IDs that can access the runner group.

value_schema.description: List of repository IDs that can access the runner group.

parameters.name: selected_workflows
parameters.description: List of workflows the runner group should be allowed to run. This setting will be ignored unless `restricted_to_workflows` is set to `true`.

value_schema.description: List of workflows the runner group should be allowed to run. This setting will be ignored unless `restricted_to_workflows` is set to `true`.

parameters.name: visibility
parameters.description: Visibility of a runner group. You can select all repositories, select individual repositories, or limit access to private repositories.

value_schema.description: Visibility of a runner group. You can select all repositories, select individual repositories, or limit access to private repositories.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
